Question_short: Is Forex Tester a one-time payment or monthly subscription?
Question_original: Do I have to pay for Forex Tester monthly or the license is valid forever after one time payment?
Answer_plain_text:
You will get a lifetime license after a one-time payment, the license includes access to basic historical data for 18 trading symbols. There are no hidden fees.

You won’t be charged in the future unless you decide to upgrade to the next major version or buy an advanced historical data subscription (please see details here).

All Forex Tester minor updates (e.g. 5.1, 5.2, etc.) are free. Our support is free as well.

The current price of the software license is available on this page.
---
By the way, you can buy several Forex Tester licenses. For what? Well, you can get a dizzy discount if you order a program for you and your bestie. It will be a win-win deal.

To purchase software:
Go to the order page https://forextester.com/order.
Select the “2 licenses” option from the drop-down list.
The price will change, and you will see how much money you can save.

It is as easy as ABC, isn’t it?

Moreover, buy Forex Tester and a data subscription in a bundle to get a discount. We can’t imagine a more attractive offer.

Just tap the link https://forextester.com/order, choose the appropriate data service subscription, and notice how much you save. Spend the saved money to purchase an ocean of your fav choco, visiting an amusement park, or ordering a desired PC or PS game.

Oh, by the way. Annual and lifetime subscriptions provide the best savings.

Psst. Wanna buy more than 2 licenses? Come forth with an untroubled heart since we’ll be happy to provide you with an even better discount!

To get details, contact our support team via support@forextester.com. Supporters will tell you about the best price that we can offer at present.

Question_short: Forex Tester 3 or 4?
Question_original: Forex Tester 3 or 4?
Answer_plain_text:
If you use Forex Tester 3, 4, or 5 then please do the following to register it.

[skip first 2 steps if the program is already installed on your computer]
1. Download Forex Tester to your new computer (you can download it here: https://forextester.com/download)
2. Install it on your computer (see installation instruction here: https://forextester.com/installation)
3. Go to the Help -> Register program
4. Enter your name, email, and registration key
5. Click the "Activate" button
6. Click the "Restart program" button

If the registration failed: Please close the program and run it again as administrator, then try to register it again.

Choose its length: monthly, annual, or lifetime.

Question_short: How to install custom indicator?
Question_original: How to install my own indicator?
Answer_plain_text:
In this case plase add this indicator/EA via Charts -> List of indicators button -> Install New Indicator/Strategies -> Add strategy->Install New Strategy (or File -> Install -> Install New Indicator/Strategy) menu.

After that, you can find an indicator in Home -> List of indicators->Custom (or Insert -> Add Indicator->Custom) menu.

And added EA can be found in Strategies -> List of strategies (or Testing -> List of strategies) menu.

Question_short: How to take a screenshot in Forex Tester?
Question_original: How to take a screenshot in Forex Tester?
Answer_plain_text:
Yes, you can take a screenshot via the Charts -> Screenshot option. Choose the required parameters and click "OK".
The picture will be saved in the Screens folder under Forex Tester's folder (C:\ForexTester\Screens by default).

This feature is very useful in case you want to share your trades with your mentor or if you are a mentor and teach others.

Question_short: Problem with indicators when applying a template?
Question_original: I have a problem with indicators when I apply a template.
Answer_plain_text:
Template saves all indicators on all timeframes, and all paint tools for a whole window. So, you can apply this template to another window but not to another timeframe of the same window.

So, for example, you can set Moving average to M5 and H1 timeframes on EURUSD and then apply this template to USDJPY and you will find moving average on the same timeframes there after applying template.

But if you apply MA to M5, save template and then try to load it on H1 (on the same window) it will just delete all current indicators and paint tools, load saved template and restore MA on M5.

Also note that in Forex Tester the indicators are attached to the timeframes but not to the whole chart, so when you see the indicators on different timeframes you actually see different instances of the indicator. If you attach your indicator to M5 timeframe you will not see it on M30 timeframe of the same chart.

This was done with optimization purpose. Because it is very time consuming to recount all indicators when you change timeframe. So, that's why every indicator is linked to a specific timeframe to avoid extra calculations when you change timeframes. If you need, for example, this indicator on timeframe M5 and M15 then place 2 indicators on both timeframes.

When you apply new indicator to the chart you can choose the timeframes where to show, after that, several independent indicator instances are created and you cannot choose the timeframes again, only edit the settings of each instance separately.

Question_short: What timeframes are available in Data Service packages?
Question_original: What timeframes are available in different Data Service packages?
Answer_plain_text:
Do you trade on D1 and higher timeframes?
In this case, there is no need to purchase any additional data services. In our Basic (free) Subscription, we provide 1-minute historical data for the 18 most popular symbols from the Forexite broker (the data starts from 01.03.2001 and it is updated monthly). These medium-quality data are useful for long-term traders who prefer to backtest their strategies on daily timeframes and higher.

Do you trade on timeframes from M1 to H4?
If you are an intraday trader and want to receive the most precise backtesting results, then please consider subscribing to the paid data services. Paid data subscriptions give you access to 800+ trading symbols including many cross-pairs, commodities, metals, and even stocks with indexes. These data are derived from different brokers and are updated on a daily basis. 

Should I choose a Standard or VIP subscription?
If you mostly trade on M1-H1 timeframes then you probably need to purchase tick data with floating spread (VIP subscription) – this will give you the most accurate testing results. If you trade on H2-H12 timeframes then you don’t need to bother yourself with tick data – Standard subscription will perfectly meet your needs.

Standard and VIP data packages are paid monthly/annual/lifetime subscriptions. Once the month/year is over, your credit card will be billed again for the same amount of money. You can cancel your subscription at any moment (just contact us at support@forextester.com)

The full information about the difference between data subscriptions and look at the current prices you can find by following this link: https://forextester.com/historyservicedescription

Should I choose a Standard or VIP subscription?
If you mostly trade on M1-H1 timeframes then you probably need to purchase tick data with floating spread (VIP subscription) – this will give you the most accurate testing results. If you trade on H2-H12 timeframes then you don’t need to bother yourself with tick data – Standard subscription will perfectly meet your needs.

Standard and VIP data packages are paid monthly/annual/lifetime subscriptions. Once the month/year is over, your credit card will be billed again for the same amount of money. You can cancel your subscription at any moment (just contact us at support@forextester.com)

The full information about the difference between data subscriptions and look at the current prices you can find by following this link: https://forextester.com/historyservicedescription

Question_short: How to test a strategy on multiple timeframes or currency pairs?
Question_original: A strategy involving several timeframes or several currency pairs
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester allows you to open any number of charts for any currency pairs after you download the data and create a project. All these charts can be of different timeframes. All the charts are synchronized in time and move simultaneously (like in a real market). This will allow you to test your strategy on several timeframes or currency pairs at the same time.

To open multiple charts, please use the "Charts ->New charts" ("File -> Add new chart") menu. Note that if you have a system with multiple screens, then you can drag the charts outside of Forex Tester's main window, so you can see different charts on different screens.

To download data, please the instructions below if you have Forex Tester 5, 4, or 3:

- Click the Data Center button -> Select the currency pair(s) -> Click the Update from server button -> Update. You can find more information about downloading and importing data here.
- Create a project through the Home - New Project (File -> New Project) menu or use the “New Project” button on the Main Toolbar. You can find more information about the projects here.
- Click the Start Test button. You can find more information about testing here.

The charts for all pairs will be moving simultaneously during testing (like in the real world).

In case you use Forex Tester 2, please do the following to download data:

- Click File -> Data Center -> Update from the server to download the data.
- Open File -> Generate Ticks -> Select the time period, currency pair(s) and generation method -> Generate.
- Switch to Testing Mode (click the History Mode button in the top left).
- Click the Start Test button.

Please note, that if you have not updated/imported the data, you can't open the charts for these pairs in the program at all.

Question_short: What OS is Forex Tester compatible with?
Question_original: What OS Forex Tester is compatible with?
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester is fully compatible with all modern Windows versions. (Windows 2000, 2003, XP, Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 10, Windows 11). Forex Tester is not compatible with Windows 95/98/Me.

There is no Linux version of the software at the moment, but you can create a virtual machine with VMWare and install Windows on it. There is no Mac version of the software for now, but you can create a virtual machine with Parallels Desktop or VMWare Fusion and install Windows on it. Please note that Forex Tester isn't compatible with VirtualBox and Wine.

Question_short: How to add custom indicators?
Question_original: I do not have the indicator I need in the list of indicators
Answer_plain_text:
You can add custom indicators into Forex Tester using Charts -> List of indicators button -> Install New Indicator (or File -> Install -> Install New Indicator) menu.

Please note, that these indicators should be written in Forex Tester format and have .dll extension.
If you have these indicators in other formats then it is necessary to convert them to FT format.
You can find API files in <Forex Tester folder>\Examples\Indicators folder.
Please see more information about API here:
Forex Tester -> Help -> API Help -> Indicators API

Question_short: What are the advantages of Forex Tester?
Question_original: Advantages of Forex Tester
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester is better than demo accounts because in Forex Tester you can:
- Test any time period from history
- Pause testing and continue later
- Correct mistakes in manual testing (e.g. go back in time and cancel or restore a closed trade)
- Control the testing speed
- Test different (sets of) strategies in the same time period.
- Test middle-term and long-term strategies much faster. With a demo account, it will take you forever to test your strategy because you will have to wait for the price to change. With Forex Tester you can speed up time and get the results much faster.
- With Forex Tester you can test your strategy on different markers (different seasons, crises, news announcements, etc..). If you test your strategy only on a demo account, then there is a HUGE risk, that your results will be valid for one state of the market but completely invalid for other states of the market. So we strongly recommend testing your strategies on different parts of history (different states of the market).

Question_short: Difference between Basic, Standard and VIP subscriptions?
Question_original: What is the difference between a Basic, Standard and VIP subscriptions?
Answer_plain_text:
Please check the information below to select which data package suits your trading style better.

Do you trade on D1 and higher timeframes?
In this case, there is no need to purchase any additional data services. In our Basic (free) Subscription, we provide 1-minute historical data for the 18 most popular symbols from the Forexite broker (the data starts from 01.03.2001 and it is updated monthly). These medium-quality data are useful for long-term traders who prefer to backtest their strategies on daily timeframes and higher.

Do you trade on timeframes from M1 to H4?
If you are an intraday trader and want to receive the most precise backtesting results, then please consider subscribing to the paid data services. Paid data subscriptions give you access to 800+ trading symbols including many cross-pairs, commodities, metals, and even stocks with indexes. These data are derived from different brokers and are updated on a daily basis. The start date of the data range varies depending on the broker.

Should I choose a Standard or VIP subscription?
If you mostly trade on M1-H1 timeframes then you probably need to purchase tick data with floating spread (VIP subscription) – this will give you the most accurate testing results. If you trade on H2-H12 timeframes then you don’t need to bother yourself with tick data – Standard subscription will perfectly meet your needs.

Standard and VIP data packages are paid monthly/annual subscriptions. Once the month/year is over, your credit card will be billed again for the same amount of money. You can cancel your subscription at any moment (just contact us at support@forextester.com).

You can read more about the historical data service and find the full list of available trading symbols on the Data Service page.

Question_short: Can I use Forex Tester on a new PC?
Question_original: What if I want to replace my new PC, can this software still be used?
Answer_plain_text:
If you use Forex Tester 5 or Forex Tester 4(3), then please register it with the same key on your new computer.
In this case, the registration will be moved to this new machine automatically.

Please do the following:
1. Download Forex Tester to your new computer (you can download it here: FT3, FT4, FT5).
2. Install it on your computer.
3. Go to the Help -> Register program.
4. Enter your name, email, and registration key.
5. Click the "Activate" button.
6. Click the "Restart program" button.

If the registration failed: Please close the program and run it again as administrator, then try to register it again.

To transfer the data please follow these simple steps:
• Open C:\ForexTester4(3) or C:\ForexTester 5 (by default) on your old PC.
• Copy the Projects, Templates and Data folders to an external drive.
• Replace these 3 folders in the Forex Tester folder on your new PC.

Question_short: Can I use a registration key from one Forex Tester version with another?
Question_original: Can I use a registration key from one Forex Tester version with other Forex Tester version?
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester registration keys will work for all the minor releases of the same major version. For example, if you have a registration key for Forex Tester 5, then this key will work for any version of Forex Tester 5 (e.g. 5.1, 5.2).

However, Forex Tester registration keys will not work for other major versions of the program. For example, the registration key for Forex Tester 5 will not work for Forex Tester 4 and vice versa.

If you have a license for an older version of Forex Tester but want to use a newer version for Forex Tester, then please upgrade your license.
If you have a license for a newer version of Forex Tester but want to use an older version for Forex Tester, then please contact us at support@forextester.com and we will issue an older registration key for you. 

By the way, you can get more benefits with the new version of Forex Tester:
— As an owner of the old-version Forex Tester license, I want something special, okay?

— You are heard. We offer you something very hard to come by. The Upgrade to Forex Tester 5 costs $99 for everybody who owns the license of an older version.

— I want more of you.

— OK. We will tell you a secret. Now it is a promotion period. The Upgrade is for just $49. So, you can save $50!

— It’s an opportunity I can’t refuse. How to purchase?

— To buy the Upgrade, use this link: https://forextester.com/ft5#app_0. Oh, wait a second. Subscribe to our Advanced-Data Service to get additional discounts for the new version.

— I know you’ve got something up your sleeve!

— When did you make us? Alright, alright. Hands on deck, hon. You can even get the upgrade *for free*.

— How?

— Buy the annual or lifetime subscription to the Advanced Data Service.

— You got a deal!

P.S. You can find information about the new features of Forex Tester 5 via https://forextester.com/ft5.

Question_short: What is a Risk/Reward tool?
Question_original: What is a Risk/Reward tool?
Answer_plain_text:
Comparing the expected returns with the amount of risk, the tool helps you to understand whether a trade is worth to be open.
Your task is to indicate the account size and acceptable risk, formulas will do the rest of the job for you. In the end, you get a clear vision of what can happen with your balance if the price goes up or down.
To find the Risk/Reward tool in the Forex Tester 5 program, please go to the Main Toolbar -> Charts -> Graphic elements -> Risk/Reward tool.

Question_short: What is StatementProcessor EA?
Question_original: What is StatementProcessor EA?
Answer_plain_text:
With the help of Statement Processor EA, you can import trade history (statement) and then "replay" the trading according to this statement.
After you import the statement and start testing, the Statement Processor EA will be opening and closing orders according to the imported statement.
The statement file should be in .txt or Html format.

Please do the following to import a statement:
1) Open Forex Tester.
2) Enable strategy execution.
3) Open strategies list.
4) Double click on the "Statement processor" strategy.
5) Specify the location of your statement file.
6) Enable the "Statement processor" strategy in the list of strategies.
7) Start a new test from the appropriate date (note that you need to have data for all the pairs that you have in the statement).

Question_short: How to close a part of an order?
Question_original: How to close a part of an order?
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester allows closing order partially.
To close the part of a position, please right-click on the order in the "Terminal" window (at the bottom of the program) and select "Close part of position".
If you placed only one order, you can Partially close it by clicking the button on the toolbar (or pressing the hotkey on a keyboard). 
If you placed some orders, you need to right-click on the order in the Open Positions or Pending Orders tab at first, then you can make one of the actions below:

In addition, you can use hotkeys for this purpose. Just select an order and press the Ctrl + F5 combination to partially close the order.

Question_short: What is Tick Data?
Question_original: What is Tick Data?
Answer_plain_text:
Tick data is the data that stores all the small changes in the price within one minute.

Let's imagine that the price has changed 36 times for 1 minute. If you use 1-min data then you will only see 4 prices of this 1M bar: Open, High, Low, and Close.
If you use the tick data, then in this particular case you will notice all 36 changes.
The tick data gives you an opportunity to backtest the strategy as if you are trading on a real market.
The tick data is a must-have for all the scalping strategies. It is also very useful for medium-term strategies for getting the best backtesting results.

To find the full difference between data subscriptions  and look at the current price please follow this link: https://forextester.com/historyservicedescription

Question_short: How to test more data in Forex Tester?
Question_original: I registered my Forex Tester but can test only 1 month of data. How can I test more data?
Answer_plain_text:
Please do the following to fix the issue:
1. Click the “Data Center” button on the Main Toolbar > select the broker from the dropdown list and click on the “Update from server” button > select the “Download part of history” radio button > set up the desired date range and click “Update”.
2. Create a new project through the File > New Project main menu or use the “New Project” button on the Main Toolbar. Give a name to the project, then click Next.
3. In the next window select the necessary pairs that you want to test and dates of testing, click “Next”.
4. Start testing from the first date in the range or define any other day to start and click “Create”.
5. Click the “Start Test” button when you are ready to start testing your strategy.

Question_short: What is backtesting?
Question_original: What is backtesting and why is it necessary?
Answer_plain_text:
Simply put, backtesting is a method which allows you to see what would have happened if you traded with your strategy in the past. For example, how reach or poor would I be if I started trading with this strategy 10 years ago? 

It is not wise to start trading live before you get solid results in backtesting.

Forex Tester is a specialized tool for backtesting. With Forex Tester you simulate trading in the past. Your charts will move just like they do in the live market, but the data will be coming from history and not from the live market. So you will get almost the same experience as you would get by trading live let's say in 2001 or 2021.

Backtesting in Forex Tester has many advantages in comparison with testing your strategies on demo accounts because in Forex Tester you can:

- Test any time period from history
- Pause testing and continue later
- Correct mistakes in manual testing (e.g. go back in time and cancel or restore a closed trade)
- Control the testing speed
- Test different (sets of) strategies in the same time period.
- Test middle-term and long-term strategies much faster. With a demo account, it will take you forever to test your strategy because you will have to wait for the price to change. With Forex Tester you can speed up time and get the results much faster.
- With Forex Tester you can test your strategy on different markers (different seasons, crises, news announcements, etc..). If you test your strategy only on a demo account, then there is a HUGE risk, that your results will be valid for one state of the market but completely invalid for other states of the market. So we strongly recommend testing your strategies on different parts of history (different states of the market).

By the way, wanna get more accurate backtesting results? Or do you crave to use high-quality historical data? You deserve all these must-have options, without which simulated trading takeoff is impossible.

If you are afraid that such “luxuries” are at a sky-high price, don’t worry, scaredy-cat. The cost of the data service depends on the subscription period and type.

Choose the best one according to your needs and preferences. The price list is on this page: https://forextester.com/historyservicedescription.

Could we interest you? In this case, tap the link below to buy a historical data subscription: https://forextester.com/historyservicedescription.

Choose its length: monthly, annual, or lifetime.
Click a corresponding button to move to the order page
Finalize your purchase.

Question_short: Can I test data on multiple timeframes simultaneously?
Question_original: Can I test data on several timeframes simultaneously? ###
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester allows you to open any required number of charts on any 
timeframes. The charts for these timeframes will be moving simultaneously.

For example, you can add multiple charts of the same currency pair and 
select a different timeframe for each chart.

All these charts are synchronized in time during testing.

You can add a new chart by clicking the “New Chart” button on the Charts 
tab.

To see all the charts on the same screen, use the Tile 
Horizontally/Vertically buttons on the Windows tab.

Question_short: Do I need to run statistics manually?
Question_original: Do I have to run statistics manually?
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester provides detailed statistics during the test, and after the trades have been closed, so you no longer have to waste your time on manual analysis!

If you’re using our latest FT5 version, the Statistics tab is displayed at the Forex Tester’s top-left corner next to the chart.

If you can’t find such a tab there, you need to enable it by clicking the “Statistics” button on the Windows tab.

If you are a Forex Tester 4 (or 3) owner, please click the View tab in the top horizontal menu, hover the cursor over the Show Panels option, and select Statistics to display the data.

In case you work with Forex Tester 2, go to View → Show Market Info and switch to the Stats tab.

Question_short: Can I install Forex Tester on multiple computers with one license?
Question_original: I purchased 1 license, and I want to install the Forex Tester on my home computer and my work computer. Can I do this?
Answer_plain_text:
If you have a Forex Tester 5 or Forex Tester 4/3 license, you can use the same registration key on a few computers. The license allows you to install the software on your PC at home and, say, on a laptop at work. You’ll be able to run the program on the PC when you are not working with it on the laptop. Working with the Forex Tester on both machines simultaneously is not possible.

Your Forex Tester 2 registration key will work for one machine only. The software is attached to your computer and cannot be registered with the same key on another device.

You can move Forex Tester 2 to another computer in case your PC has crashed, or you bought a new PC.

Question_short: Can I create a custom timeframe?
Question_original: Can I create a custom timeframe?
Answer_plain_text:
Yes, you can do it easily by clicking the gear button in the Timeframe section on the Home tab. Click “Add timeframe” and enter the necessary value into the field. For example, if you want to make a 6-hour timeframe, multiply it by 60 and enter 360. You can delete the unnecessary timeframes as well.

You can also make this list of timeframes default for your new projects by clicking the “Make default” button.

Question_short: What is a Quick Test in Forex Tester?
Question_original: What is a Quick Test in the Forex Tester?
Answer_plain_text:
A Quick Test is a feature that allows you to get fast backtesting results. If you have many different strategies and need to get a basic knowledge of their profit rate, the Quick Test option is just right.

In FT5, you can run your Quick Test by clicking the corresponding button on the Strategies tab.

In Forex Tester 3 and 4, starting the Fast Test is available via the icon on the main toolbar. 

In Forex Tester 2, the same icon is available in the Testing Mode.

When you find the strategy that works, it is time to switch to a standard test and look at your strategy in more detail.

Question_short: What are the differences between Basic, Standard, and Super (VIP) subscriptions?
Question_original: What is the difference between a Basic, Standard, and Super (VIP) subscriptions?
Answer_plain_text:
In Basic (free) Subscription we provide historical data for 18 pairs from Forexite broker.
These data are provided from 1st January 2001 till 28 February 2023 (free data are updated monthly at the beginning of a new month). These data don’t have volumes, so each 1-minute bar has 1-4 ticks in it.
We recommend using these data on higher timeframes (15-30M or higher).

In Paid Data Service we provide 1-minute data with real volumes (Standard Subscription) and real tick data with Bid and Ask prices (Super (VIP) Subscription). These data have better quality, and we recommend using them for more precise testing.
Standard subscription (minute data of high quality) is a paid service that has the following advantages in comparison with the free data package: 800+ symbols (including stocks, indexes, commodities, futures, cryptocurrencies); daily updates; 5-digits data.
It also provides fundamental news for 9 main currencies.

Super (VIP) subscription (minute and tick data of high quality) includes all advantages of the Standard package + tick data with floating spread.
Tick data shows all the price changes, even the smallest ones, so it will give you the most accurate results (especially useful for short-term and scalping strategies).

Super (VIP) and Standard and data packages are paid monthly/annual/Lifetime subscriptions. Once the month/year is over, your credit card will be billed again for the same amount of money. A lifetime subscription is a one-time payment.

Please note that the subscription allows you to download all the data from the beginning of our history until the day it expires.
All downloaded data will be stored on your computer, so you will be able to use them in the future.
Please consider backups, so you will be able to have access to all downloaded data even after the end of your subscription.

The price of the data service depends on the length of the subscription. You can find the pricing in the table on this page http://www.forextester.com/HistoryServiceDescription.
Please note that you can get a discount for data service subscription if you buy it in a bundle with Forex Tester license https://forextester.com/order.

Question_short: How to back up data?
Question_original: How can I back up my data?
Answer_plain_text:
Please open C:\ForexTester (by default) on your PC and copy the Data folders to an external drive.
Another way is exporting data in ".csv" files through the Data Center.
In this case, please launch the Forex Tester program and open Data Center window for this, then select a necessary symbol and download historical data for this symbol via the "Update from server" button.
After that, click the вЂњExportвЂќ button, enter the name of the file where data will be exported, select a necessary timeframe (for example, H1), and click the "Export" button to finish the process.
After that, you will be able to save ".csv" files on an external drive and open it with Excel.

After that, click the вЂњExportвЂќ button, enter the name of the file where data will be exported, select a necessary timeframe (for example, H1), and click the "Export" button to finish the process.

Question_short: Why wasn't my strategy/indicator file converted automatically?

Answer_plain_text:
Sorry, but not all MT4 EAs can be converted into the Forex Tester format automatically.

Question_short: How to copy a chart template to another chart?
Question_original: How can I copy the template from one chart and then apply it to another one?
Answer_plain_text:
You can save indicators/drawings on a chart as a template (right-click on the chart -> Templates -> Save Template) and then add this template to another chart (right-click on a new chart -> Templates -> select a necessary template).

In this case, indicators/drawings will be saved on this chart too.

Please also note that you can also activate the "Save template as default" option when saving a template and this template will be automatically applied to all newly opened charts.

Please follow this tutorial to see how to work with templates.

Question_short: How to generate ticks in Forex Tester?
Question_original: Forex Tester 2 and below
Answer_plain_text:
You need to switch to the "History Mode" (via the drop-down menu at the top left of the program), open the Data Center window, click the "Generate ticks" button.
In the appeared window select all necessary symbols, enter start and end dates of testing and click the "Generate" button.

After that, switch to the Testing Mode, add charts of all necessary pairs via File -> Add New chart menu, and start a new test by clicking the "Start Test" button.

In the appeared window select all necessary symbols, enter start and end dates of testing and click the "Generate" button.

After that, switch to the Testing Mode, add charts of all necessary pairs via File -> Add New chart menu, and start a new test by clicking the "Start Test" button.

Question_short: How to customize default chart appearance?
Question_original: How can I customize the default appearance of charts in Forex Tester?
Answer_plain_text:
In order to change the default chart appearance, please do the following:

- Make all necessary changes in the settings of one chart (right-click on the chart -> Chart Settings) and apply the changes.
- Then save these changes as a template:
  - Right-click on the chart window > Templates > Save template
  - Check the "Save template as default" box (in Forex Tester 3 and later) or save the template with the name "default" if you are using Forex Tester 2.
  - Click Save and overwrite the existing template.
Answer_original:
In order to change the default chart appearance, please do the following:
 
  • Make all necessary changes in the settings of one chart (right-click on the chart -> Chart Settings) and apply the changes.
  • Then save these changes as a template:
    • Right-click on the chart window > Templates > Save template
    • Check the "Save template as default" box (in Forex Tester 3 and later) or save the template with the name "default" if you are using Forex Tester 2.
    • Click Save and overwrite the existing template.

Question_short: Can I use my Forex Tester 4 registration key for Forex Tester 5?
Question_original: Can I apply the Forex Tester 4 registration key to register Forex Tester 5?
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester registration keys will work for all the minor releases of the same major version. For example, if you have a registration key for Forex Tester 5, then this key will work for any version of Forex Tester 5 (e.g. 5.1, 5.2).

However, Forex Tester registration keys will not work for other major versions of the program. For example, the registration key for Forex Tester 5 will not work for Forex Tester 4 and vice versa.

If you have a license for an older version of Forex Tester but want to use a newer version for Forex Tester, then please upgrade your license.
If you have a license for a newer version of Forex Tester but want to use an older version for Forex Tester, then please contact us at support@forextester.com and we will issue an older registration key for you. 

By the way, you can get more benefits with the new version of Forex Tester:
- As an owner of the old-version Forex Tester license, I want something special, okay?

- You are heard. We offer you something very hard to come by. The Upgrade to Forex Tester 5 costs $99 for everybody who owns the license of an older version.

- I want more of you.

- OK. We will tell you a secret. Now it is a promotion period. The Upgrade is for just $49. So, you can save $50!

- It's an opportunity I can't refuse. How to purchase?

- To buy the Upgrade, use this link: https://forextester.com/ft5#app_0. Oh, wait a second. Subscribe to our Advanced-Data Service to get additional discounts for the new version.

- I know you've got something up your sleeve!

- When did you make us? Alright, alright. Hands on deck, hon. You can even get the upgrade *for free*.

- How?

- Buy the annual or lifetime subscription to the Advanced Data Service.

- You got a deal!

P.S. You can find information about the new features of Forex Tester 5 via https://forextester.com/ft5.

Question_short: How to remove Buy and Sell labels from charts?
Question_original: I see annoying Buy and Sell labels on the charts
Answer_plain_text:
To switch on/off the signs of the previous trades please do the following:
1. Right-click on the chart.
2. Select “Chart settings” and go to the “Chart Options” tab.
3. Uncheck the “Show Account history” option.
4. Click “Ok” to save the changes.

Question_short: Can I close a part of an order?
Question_original: Can I close a part of an order?
Answer_plain_text:
Forex Tester allows closing order partially.
To close the part of a position, please right-click on the order in the "Terminal" window (at the bottom of the program) and select "Close part of position".
If you placed only one order, you can Partially close it by clicking the button on the toolbar (or pressing the hotkey on a keyboard). 
If you placed some orders, you need to right-click on the order in the Open Positions or Pending Orders tab at first, then you can make one of the actions below:

In addition, you can use hotkeys for this purpose. Just select an order and press the Ctrl + F5 combination to partially close the order.

Question_short: How to fix the error message when trying to download data?
Question_original: I cannot start a test
Answer_plain_text:
If you see an error message when you try to download data, please check that you have enough free space on the local disk where Forex Tester program is installed.
If you use antivirus/firewall, please try to disable them for a few minutes or add our software to the list of trusted programs.
After that, launch the Forex Tester program as administrator (right-click -> run as administrator) and try to download historical data again.
